back_cards.definition_en: The fifth day of the week, following Thursday.
back_cards.example_en: I have a meeting every Friday morning.

back_cards.definition_en: A day often associated with the end of the workweek.
back_cards.example_en: We usually go out for dinner on Friday nights.

back_cards.definition_en: A day for casual dress in some workplaces.
back_cards.example_en: Our office has a casual Friday policy.

back_cards.definition_en: A day referenced in scheduling events.
back_cards.example_en: The concert is happening next Friday at the park.

back_cards.definition_en: A day in religious or cultural contexts.
back_cards.example_en: Good Friday is an important day during Easter.

back_cards.definition_en: A professional who practices law and represents clients.
back_cards.example_en: The attorney reviewed the contract before we signed it.

back_cards.definition_en: A person appointed to act for another in legal matters.
back_cards.example_en: She hired an attorney to handle her divorce.

back_cards.definition_en: A legal advisor in a corporate setting.
back_cards.example_en: The company's attorney advised against the merger.
The attorney argued the case before the judge.

back_cards.definition_en: A specialist in a specific legal field.
back_cards.example_en: We need a tax attorney to sort out these issues.

back_cards.definition_en: Except if; used to introduce a condition.
back_cards.example_en: You can't go to the party unless you finish your homework.

back_cards.definition_en: Indicating an exception to a statement.
back_cards.example_en: I’ll be there by noon unless something urgent comes up.

back_cards.definition_en: Used to set a condition in plans.
back_cards.example_en: We won’t cancel the picnic unless it rains heavily.
Unless you call ahead, they won’t reserve a table.
No one enters the lab unless they wear safety gear.

back_cards.definition_en: Used to introduce a further negative statement.
back_cards.example_en: She didn’t call, nor did she send a message.
I have neither the time nor the energy to argue.
Nor rain nor snow will stop the delivery.
He won’t apologize, nor should he have to.
‘I don’t like coffee.’ ‘Nor do I.’

back_cards.definition_en: A person with extensive knowledge in a field.
back_cards.example_en: The expert fixed our computer system in an hour.

back_cards.definition_en: A specialist consulted for professional advice.
back_cards.example_en: We called an expert to evaluate the antique.

back_cards.definition_en: A recognized authority in a niche area.
back_cards.example_en: She’s an expert in marine biology.

back_cards.definition_en: A contributor to discussions or media.
back_cards.example_en: The news channel invited an expert to discuss the economy.

back_cards.definition_en: A mentor in a training context.
back_cards.example_en: Our expert guided us through the software tutorial.

back_cards.definition_en: The arrangement or framework of something.
back_cards.example_en: The structure of the building is very modern.

back_cards.definition_en: A system or organization of parts.
back_cards.example_en: The company’s structure includes several departments.

back_cards.definition_en: The composition of a text or work.
back_cards.example_en: The essay has a clear structure with an introduction and conclusion.
The bridge’s structure was designed to withstand earthquakes.

back_cards.definition_en: The underlying pattern in data or ideas.
back_cards.example_en: Scientists studied the structure of the molecule.

back_cards.definition_en: A financial plan for spending and saving.
back_cards.example_en: We created a budget for our vacation.

back_cards.definition_en: An allocation of funds for a project.
back_cards.example_en: The film had a small budget but was a huge success.

back_cards.definition_en: A limit on spending in daily life.
back_cards.example_en: I’m on a tight budget this month.
The city council approved the annual budget.
The marketing budget was increased this year.

back_cards.definition_en: A policy to protect against financial loss.
back_cards.example_en: Car insurance is mandatory in most states.
Her insurance covered the hospital bills.

back_cards.definition_en: A business contract for risk management.
back_cards.example_en: The company offers home insurance plans.
Travel insurance saved us when our flight was canceled.
The job includes health insurance for employees.
The book’s text was easy to read.

back_cards.definition_en: A message sent via mobile phone.
back_cards.example_en: I sent her a text about the meeting time.

back_cards.definition_en: The main content of a document.
back_cards.example_en: The text of the speech was inspiring.
The professor assigned a new text for the course.
He prefers text over email for quick updates.

back_cards.definition_en: The state of being free from restrictions.
back_cards.example_en: Freedom of speech is a core value here.
After college, she enjoyed her newfound freedom.
The country fought for its freedom.
Financial freedom allows her to travel often.

back_cards.definition_en: A right or privilege in society.
back_cards.example_en: Freedom to vote is essential in a democracy.
The party got crazy after midnight.
She’s crazy about her new puppy.

back_cards.definition_en: Unusual or surprising in a situation.
back_cards.example_en: It’s crazy how fast time flies.
Work has been crazy this week.
His crazy ideas actually worked out.

back_cards.definition_en: A person who reads books or texts.
back_cards.example_en: She’s an avid reader of mystery novels.
The card reader scanned my payment quickly.

back_cards.definition_en: A participant in a reading program.
back_cards.example_en: The young reader won a library award.

back_cards.definition_en: An audience member for written content.
back_cards.example_en: The blog has thousands of loyal readers.

back_cards.definition_en: A tool for accessing digital content.
back_cards.example_en: I use an e-reader for all my books.
Her writing style is very poetic.
Vintage style is popular this season.
His teaching style engages students.

back_cards.definition_en: A design or aesthetic in art.
back_cards.example_en: The building has a modern architectural style.
Jazz is my favorite music style.

back_cards.definition_en: Moving from one side to another.
back_cards.example_en: We walked through the park.
She read through the entire book.
I heard the news through a friend.
We worked through the night.
The bullet went through the wall.

back_cards.definition_en: The third month of the year.
back_cards.example_en: My birthday is in March.
March brings warmer weather to our town.
The festival happens every March.
The march of 1963 was a turning point.
Classes start again in early March.

back_cards.definition_en: A mechanical device for performing tasks.
back_cards.example_en: The factory uses a new machine for packaging.
This machine processes data quickly.
I washed my clothes in the washing machine.
The political machine influenced the election.

back_cards.definition_en: A piece of equipment in fitness.
back_cards.example_en: He trains on the rowing machine daily.

back_cards.definition_en: The eleventh month of the year.
back_cards.example_en: November is usually cold here.
Thanksgiving is in late November.

back_cards.definition_en: A month for elections or events.
back_cards.example_en: The marathon is scheduled for November.
The treaty was signed in November 1918.
Sales pick up in November before the holidays.

back_cards.definition_en: A group of people born around the same time.
back_cards.example_en: My generation grew up with the internet.
The generation of electricity is costly.

back_cards.definition_en: A stage in a family lineage.
back_cards.example_en: This farm has been in our generation for decades.
The new generation of phones is faster.
The 60s generation shaped modern music.
Her income comes from her teaching job.
The rental property provides steady income.
Their household income is above average.
The company’s income grew this quarter.
I save part of my income every month.

back_cards.definition_en: Having come into existence by birth.
back_cards.example_en: She was born in a small village.
He’s a born leader in our team.

back_cards.definition_en: Associated with a time or place.
back_cards.example_en: I’m a born New Yorker.
The idea was born during the meeting.
She’s a born artist with incredible skills.
